text: Joan Maria Thomàs Andreu (born 1953 in Palma) is a Spanish historian. He is professor of Contemporary History at the Rovira i Virgili University and corresponding member of the Royal Academy of History. His academic production has focused on the history of falangism and the international relations of Spain during the Francoist dictatorship. == Works == * * * * * * * == References == ;Informational notes ;Citations ;Bibliography * * * * * * * Category:Living people Category:1953 births Category:Historians of fascism Category:Academics and writers on the international relations of Spain Category:Historians of Francoist Spain
title: Joan Maria Thomàs
